description: LATex makes printed documents look great, and Lyx makes it easy to use. Import your exported graphs from Octave or where ever, type in your formulas and derivations, and your work will look ready to publish. It was always a thrill to see how great my stuff came out.
summary: Makes engineering or science homework looks like a million bucks

description: What a truly wonderful way to create and work. Still learning but our marriage is just beginning. Has so many rich features for making your words look as important as they feel.
summary: I fell in love on our first date

description: Great! A wonderful LaTeX writting envirment
summary: Great! A wonderful LaTeX writting envirment

description: The best for serious typewriting! I use it since the beginning of my latex experience and this is long time ago!

This nifty writer does its own thing and does it well. As a cherry on top, it's easy to use immediately and less time is wasted on trying to find things. 

Great features I love about this application are:
1. how much easier it is to navigate around the document without page imitation,
2. placing graphics isn't a battle, and 
3. a lot of necessities are already done for you, like page numbering.

nuff said.
I have been using LyX exclusively since the middle 2000's, and I produce a lot of documents that need to look good. It is a great program.
The best word processor for latex
Great tool for Latex capabilities without coding it all by hand. Great for maths. Available on Windows too.
summary: Power of Latex without thinking about it

description: it is clear and very good sound
summary: it is clear and very good sound

description: As a scientist I write a lot of mathematical equations in my papers and other documents. Lyx has a fantastic equation editor that makes this very easy. It's also very fast and easy to learn to use it.

I wrote my entire thesis in engineering with this tool. Hundreds of complex equations written and rendered perfectly. The best tool I could choose to write it. The quality is incredibly high, result is at the same level of a professional engineering manual. Congratulations to the authors.

This allows me to write notes and papers with mathematical formulae exactly as I need them. The output looks like a professionally typeset publication. 
However, with longer documents it occasionally splatters my edits randomly across the document. This is not a deal breaker but do make sure to carefully proof-read your document before you publish.

I have been using it for years for writing academic papers and thesis book.
Great apps for beautiful document.
summary: Excellent for academics and professional writing

description: With lyx , there is no strong need to recite the tedious latex commands, however, it is helpful to be familiar with different latex commands thanks to the code preview pannel.
summary: the most efficient latex editor I have ever met

description:
This is a great program for making very professional documents. I typically use it for the many reports I write as a Chemical Engineering student. 

I always liked the appearance of documents created using LaTeX and have many professors who use it. But I felt like it was time consuming trying to use a typical LaTeX editor to get started making documents. This program has helped me get that appearance without the hassle. Thanks for the great software.
summary: Great For Creating High Quality Documents

description: A very intuitive software that increase your production during professional document build.

The idea of LaTeX - as I understand it - is that a document is professionally formatted without bothering the user to constantly readjust their formatting to accommodate changes. Or, in other words: The author should not be distracted by non-writing tasks during writing. Unfortunately when writing LaTeX, one is constantly bothered by the Code. Lyx alleviates this problem by providing an environment where the usage of code is almost entirely optional and the author can focus completely on writing. It takes away almost all non-writing distraction one regularly encounters in other Document processing software. I've started out in LaTeX and I'm using Lyx for many years now. To me there is no better document processing software! On top of all this, almost any argument between a typical Word user and a typical LaTeX user is settled in Lyx.
summary: The Best of the LaTeX Philosophy

description: Way faster than writing raw latex code.
Used LyX for 5+ years, it's been very helpful for user with minimal TeX Knowledge. Expecting further develepment for dealing with mixed EN and AR documents.
summary: Awesome Document Editor for Scientific writing

description: It eliminates the need to learn all the details of Latex.

Work on your content, and just focus.
This is a probably the best tool for text production.
I am in love with Lyx, wrote my articles and thesis with Lyx. Thanks much for its creators!

Lyx is an excellent program with which to compose documents! I love how it enables you to focus largely on the content of your document rather than on markup code. Basically, Lyx is similar to Adobe FrameMaker, which I used for a while to write technical documents at my employer before they switched to MS Word about 20 years ago. If Lyx developers want to know where the project should head, they need look no futher than FrameMaker as a model.
summary: Excellent application with which to prepare documents!

description:
There is still room for improvements, but this is by far the best LaTeX editor out there!

I would like to have the buttons to set the text styles and dimensions in a fashon similar to that of `LibreOffice Writer`
Starts with an error message about article class not found

Old Lyx can't open the new doc saved by this version.
It is a headache if one should use different computer ...

Great offline tool for producing scientific documents, but also other small PDF documents. I've used it several years on my Linux machines. The equations are also compatible with Overleaf, which makes it useful as an wysiwyg-equation editor with formulas that can be copied into Overleaf. Also works to copy equations from Wikipedia into LyX, although some "washing" are required it saves a lot of work compared to write the equations from scratch.
summary: Great tool for producing scientific documents

description: Economist, and have used technical editors for many years, including latex. LyX is by the far the best and most efficient editor for science. I use it with Jabref to get great bibliography support - Jabref can be used to organize and keep notes on papers and citations in one location.

It produces beautiful documents and beautiful formulas, including ones that I can't write in LibreOffice. For example, marking a set of equations with brackets on only one side.

It does have a few shortcomings, though:

1. The default choices for fonts could be better. The current defaults make the documents look a little old fashioned, like they were printed in a previous decade.
2. There's too little control for numbering items. For example, I'd like to be able to choose the format for numbering sections, but if I use automatic numbering together with parts then sections will be numbered 1.1, 1.2, etc, when I might want to just have the sections within each part be numbered 1, 2, etc. Or formulas seem to always follow global numbering when I might want to restart the numbering for each part or section.
3. Support for Hebrew output, and likely other languages as well, is not there out of the box. For that I have to install the package texlive-full to get everything I need (although it's possible I don't need all the dependencies that texlive-full pulls in). That's a huge and lengthy installation of about 5 GB. Then I still need to play around with the document settings in order to choose the rendering backend that works for Hebrew (IIRC xetex) and couple that with a choice of fonts that support Hebrew. There are very few of those by default, but I was able to find a few nice ones from Google Fonts, like Rubik.
4. Hebrew text inside of formulas is displayed in reverse.
summary: Great app for writing documents with math

description: Stable and reliable, especially for large documents. Writing is free of distraction and frustration, and the end product looks great. Plenty of features, but if one should be missing, you can always embed some snippets of TeX source code directly as well.
summary: Got me through my diploma thesis

description:
Great editor! Even with no ERT (evil red text) it makes it a breeze to work on very long documents with elaborate equations, although fine-tuning requiring in-depth knowledge of TeX and ERT. Since I am a long-time TeX user, that's no extra cost for me.

I can't handle the "no newline" straightjacket, despite years of trying, so I "save as default" this snippet in "Document > Settings > Local Layout" with "FreeSpacing" enabled:

Style Standard
  Category       MainText
  Margin        Static
  LatexType       Paragraph
  LatexName       dummy
  ParIndent       MM
  ParSkip        0.4
  Align         Block
  AlignPossible     Block, Left, Right, Center
  LabelType       No_Label
  KeepEmpty       true
  FreeSpacing      true
  HTMLStyle
    div.standard {
      margin-bottom: 2ex;
    }
  EndHTMLStyle
End
überraschend hilfreich, um fokusiert zu schreiben! Gutes Programm!
Lyx ist anders und Lyx ist gut.
Lyx vereint perfekt die Trennung von Layout und Inhalt mit einer komfortablen Umgebung.
Sehr hilfreich, um Texte zu setzen, insbesondere der Mathematik-Modus!
LATEX-Qualität ohne LATEX-Programmierung. Für viele Szenarien auseichend gut. Einfach. Schnell.
diese anwendung kann ich daher nicht beurteilen...
summary: nicht installierbar weder über das terminal oder normal

description: Es uno de los programas que más uso. Es mucho más potente que LibreOffice Writer, y los resultados son preciosos. Vale la pena el tiempo invertido en aprender a manejarlo.

Buena aplicación para textos científicos, los presenta de forma elegante, y ayuda mucho en la composición de texto. Un poco difícil de manejar, pero vale la pena el esfuerzo. Tiene incorporado sus propios manuales.
Fantásticos documentos de calidad profesional.
El mejor procesador que existe, es increible la calidad de documentos que podemos hacer.
En la página web del proyecto se indica claramente que la licencia de este software es libre.
summary: ¿Por qué la licencia indica que es propietaria?

description: Concéntrate en escribir y el editor se encarga del resto
Llevo con éste editor de latex más de una década, lo he usado para generar en mi trabajo infinidad de documentos, también para la elaboración de manuales, libros... Moriré con él.
Application géniale ! Cependant, ne s'intègre pas forcément bien si on a un autre thème installé (surtout sous Wayland...).

Le seul regret avec mon utilisation et la quasi impossibilité de compiler des fichiers avec des scripts python.
One regret how to compile ly file with python scripts inside ?????
merssi  bokou

Ubuntu ne propose plus LyX, en partie parce qu'il ne le propose qu'incomplet et bogué.
La version disponible ailleurs est la 2.3.7.
Sur mon portable sous Win 10, la compilation d'un manuel scientifique de 500 pages se déroule correctement.
Mais pas ici sous Ubuntu : trop d'erreurs, et pas de sortie en pdf.

LyX est la seule approche quasi-wysiwyg de la publication LateX.
N'hésitez pas à envoyer vos commentaires ou questions à lyx-users@lists.lyx.org ou (en Français) lyx-fr@lists.lyx.org.
summary: Je suis biaisé, je suis développeur

description:
Подробные сообщения об ошибках от менеджера пакетов:

E: Работа dpkg прервана, вы должны вручную запустить «dpkg --configure -a» для устранения проблемы.
I'm writing articles with LyX for about 4 years. It's a stable and effective tool!
半个小时了，才30%，不知何时结束
下载慢的，请先检查是否通过软件源安装了texlive-full

百度 "ubuntu 使用国内镜像", 在系统设置中改为国内镜像源即可.
安装软件就会很快了.
summary: 下载过慢是因为默认使用国外源

description:
资料少,有交流群吗
凑字数凑字数凑字数凑字数凑字数凑字数凑字数凑字数
虽然没有写ctex中文宏包的大神弄的漂亮（注意不是ctex发行版，是ctex中文环境），bug也不少，但是至少能减轻手写+看着一堆转义/特殊符号堆砌的痛苦，直观好用
